description:
nova trunk as of 16Dec2011 10:00 PST

iscsiadm fails to logout volume on detach:

2011-12-16 13:22:46,624 DEBUG nova.virt.libvirt.volume [-] iscsiadm ('--op', 'update', '-n', 'node.startup', '-v', 'manual'): stdout= stderr= from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:982011-12-16 13:22:46,624 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iscsiadm -m node -T iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002 -p 50.56.12.210:3260 - - l o g o u t from (pid=25446) execute /opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py:198
2011-12-16 13:22:46,637 DEBUG nova.virt.libvirt.volume [-] iscsiadm --logout: stdout=
# BEGIN RECORD 2.0-871
node.name = iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002
node.tpgt = -1
node.startup = manual
...
# END RECORD
 stderr= from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:98
2011-12-16 13:22:46,638 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iscsiadm -m node -T iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002 -p 50.56.12.210:3260 --op delete from (pid=25446) execute /opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py:198
2011-12-16 13:22:46,651 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 255 from (pid=25446) execute /opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py:214
2011-12-16 13:22:46,652 DEBUG nova.virt.libvirt.volume [-] iscsiadm ('--op', 'delete'): stdout= stderr=iscsiadm: This command will remove the record [iface: default, target: iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002, portal: 50.56.12.210,3260], but a session is using it. Logout session then rerun command to remove record.iscsiadm: Could not execute operation on all records. Err 22. from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:98
2011-12-16 13:22:46,662 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/exception.py", line 115, in wrapped
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 115, in decorated_function
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     function(self, context, instance_uuid, *args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1485, in detach_volume
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._detach_volume(context, instance_ref['name'], bdm)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1476, in _detach_volume
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     mp)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/exception.py", line 115, in wrapped
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 445, in detach_volume
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise exception.DiskNotFound(location=mount_device)
(nova.rpc): TRACE: DiskNotFound: No disk at vdb
title: Volume detach doesn't work

comments.content:
nova trunk as of 16Dec2011 10:00 PST

iscsiadm fails to logout volume on detach:

2011-12-16 13:22:46,624 DEBUG nova.virt.libvirt.volume [-] iscsiadm ('--op', 'update', '-n', 'node.startup', '-v', 'manual'): stdout= stderr= from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:982011-12-16 13:22:46,624 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iscsiadm -m node -T iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002 -p 50.56.12.210:3260 - - l o g o u t from (pid=25446) execute /opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py:198

# BEGIN RECORD 2.0-871
node.name = iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000002
node.tpgt = -1
node.startup = manual
...
# END RECORD
 stderr= from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:98

Logout session then rerun command to remove record.iscsiadm: Could not execute operation on all records. Err 22. from (pid=25446) _run_iscsiadm /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py:98

(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data

comments.content: looks like commit ed1b801a accidentally changed a tuple into a parened string.   Proposing a fix.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
Yeah, I found that, but now detach is failing with this:

2011-12-16 14:05:26,938 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py",
line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/exception.py", line
115, in wrapped
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py",
line 115, in decorated_function
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     function(self, context, instance_uuid, *args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py",
line 1487, in detach_volume
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self.volume_api.detach(context, volume_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/volume/api.py", line
206, in detach
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     "args": {"volume_id": volume_id}})
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/__init__.py", line
45, in call
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return get_impl().call(context, topic, msg)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py",
line 747, in call
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rv = list(rv)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py",
line 715, in __iter__
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise result
(nova.rpc): TRACE: RemoteError: Remote error: AdminRequired User does
not have admin privileges
(nova.rpc): TRACE: [u'Traceback (most recent call last):\n
', u'  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in
_process_data\n
    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n
', u'  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/volume/manager.py", line 248, in
detach_volume\n
    self.db.volume_detached(context, volume_id)\n
', u'  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/db/api.py", line 981, in volume_detached\n
    return IMPL.volume_detached(context, volume_id)\n
', u'  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 94, in wrapper\n
    raise exception.AdminRequired()\n
', u'AdminRequired: User does not have admin privileges\n'

comments.content:
updated fix to use context.elevated()

Not sure if attach / detach should require elevated context or not, or where it "should" be done, but this gets it working for now.
